page.title: 08Village Life
page.content: Mr. Slade has lived in West Buckland for six years,before he lived in Epsom.He now lives in Rosebank cottage.He moved here because his wife was offered a job in the hospital in Barnstaple,he was retired and this cottage was available. Every morning he drives his wife into Barnstaple and if needed drives her round to local hospitals. He likes the village because there is less traffic,more fresh air and less volume of commutor life. His hobbies are writing short stories for the radio,he does voluntary work for RAF Chivenor,he plays cricket and likes doing some "fancy cooking".The village shop is good but he prefers Barnstaple as he has to go in there every day and there is a better selection of goods. Richard Newton
